data.description: The infill density defines the amount of plastic used on the inside of the print. A higher infill density means that there is more plastic on the inside of your print, leading to a stronger object.
data.img_description: The model on the left has a lighter infill density than the model on the right.
data.hints: - An infill density around 20% is used for models with a visual purpose, higher densities can be used for end-use parts.
